products.name: Drum Machine Collection
products.description:
Roland drum machines have inspired artists and defined genres for decades. With the Drum Machine Collection, you get five of our most revered rhythm machines from the ’80s, recreated as modern plug-ins with new sound-shaping options and advanced sequencing capabilities. Backed by our Analog Circuit Behavior (ACB) technology, these iconic instruments are brought to life with breathtaking realism in your DAW—and all for one low price.

The Roland drum machines in this collection have served as the rhythmic backbones for countless tracks over the past 40 years. Their creative impact is undisputed, and they continue to drive modern music across a range of styles. These authentic recreations sound and behave just like the vintage hardware, coupled with advanced programming features and extended sound-shaping options for today’s production styles.

Thanks to our proprietary circuit modeling technology, these classics are ready to imbue your tracks with retro energy and fuel tomorrow’s masterpieces. The ACB process involves carefully analyzing original hardware units, circuit diagrams, and other historical data. We then use this information to recreate the authentic circuit behaviors of the vintage instruments—including all their beloved quirks and instabilities—giving these rhythm machines their amazingly lifelike sound and organic response.

TR-808
Released in 1980, the TR-808 is one of the most revered and sought-after electronic musical instruments of all time—and its influence only continues to grow. While it dominated the sound of emerging rap and hip-hop styles, new musical genres make heavy use of the 808 sound with its unmistakable boom, snap, and sizzle. The 808’s effect on music is so deep that it’s been name-dropped in famous songs, had albums dedicated to it, bands named after it, and is even the subject of a feature-length documentary film.

TR-606
The TR-606 Software Rhythm Composer is a detailed replica of the TR-606 Drumatix from 1981—an underground classic in the famous TR family of rhythm machines. The punchy midrange kicks, popping toms, and sizzling hi-hats were a hit with DIY musicians and have appeared across an array of genres, from ’80s new wave and punk to electronic styles. Today’s musicians continue to seek out the TR-606 for its alternative approach to the Roland TR sound.

TR-909
Released in 1983, the influence of the TR-909 drum machine is still heard—and felt—nearly four decades after it was launched. Much like the TR-808’s dominance in rap and hip-hop, the TR-909 left an indelible mark on electronic music styles like techno, house, acid, and industrial. From the “uhn tiss” of its thumpy kick and chunky hi-hats to the snappy snare rolls used in dramatic builds, it’s the sound you hear in your head when you think of hard-driving, floor-shaking dance music.

TR-707
The now-famous TR-707 Rhythm Composer was released in 1985. Taking its rightful place next to other classic Roland drum machines, this previously underrated instrument has since appeared on hit tracks in a long list of genres, including synth-pop, acid house, industrial, electro, indie, alternative, and more. Taking inspiration from aftermarket modifications, the massively updated sound-shaping options in the plug-in let you adjust tuning, decay, attack, snappy, gain, sample rate, and more.

TR-727
Roland introduced the TR-727 Rhythm Composer alongside the TR-707 in 1985. Lesser known but no less loved, this Latin percussion-packed sibling has found its way into a wide range of styles over the decades, from tribal and acid house to pop and techno. And it’s also perfect for afrobeat, reggaeton, and more exotic contemporary styles. This software recreation perfectly nails that vintage vibe, expanded with tuning, decay, and other manipulations that make the creative possibilities bloom.

The Drum Machine Collection offers sophisticated integration with the Roland TR-8S Rhythm Performer. Adjust the software instrument controls in real time using the array of knobs and sliders on the TR-8S. And instantly send your patterns back and forth between the hardware and the plug-ins.

The Drum Machine Collection is available with a special Roland Cloud Lifetime Key purchase that offers a significant saving over purchasing each title individually. Roland Cloud is also home to software versions of other vintage Roland instruments plus ZENOLOGY, ZENOLOGY FX, Zenbeats, and other inspiring music tools to back your creative journeys.

Start using the instruments in the Drum Machine Collection for free today with a Roland Cloud 30-day trial membership.

You can also contact our Product Support through Roland Backstage.

products.name: DW 50th Anniversary: Producer Position
products.description:
The DW 50th Anniversary kit is an artisan-grade drum set with hybrid shells constructed from a unique combination of persimmon and spruce. Persimmon is a hard tone wood that produces thick attack and projection, while the softer spruce balances the sound with warmth and richness.

Rack Toms—8 x 10" and 9 x 12"
Floor Toms—12 x 14" and 14 x 16"
Kick Drum—18 x 22"

products.name: DW Design Series Acrylic: Drummer Position
products.description:
The DW Design Series Acrylic kit delivers the bright and fat attack, focused tone, and controlled sustain that great acrylic shells are known for. These powerful drum sounds are well-suited for any musical style that needs extra cut, from aggressive rock and heavy metal to punk, hardcore, and nu metal. This collection includes an acrylic snare that matches the tom and kick drums, plus a bell bronze True-Cast snare with a dark, earthy tone and low-end punch.

Rack Toms—7 x 8", 8 x 10", and 9 x 12"
Floor Toms—12 x 14", 14 x 16", and 16 x 18"
Kick Drum—18 x 22"
Snare Drum 1—Design Series Clear Acrylic 5.5 x 14"
Snare Drum 2—DW MFG True-Cast Bronze 5 x 14"

products.name: DW Jazz Series Maple Gum: Drummer Position
products.description:
The DW Jazz Series Maple Gum kit features seven-ply hybrid gum shells that start with a three-ply core of 1/20" gumwood sandwiched between maple plies without reinforcement hoops. Pairing the soft gumwood with hard maple yields a bright sound with medium sustain and a round bottom end, providing rich tones that are suitable for everything from bebop to pop. This collection includes two gumwood/maple snare and kick drums, each offering a subtly different feel.

Kick Drums—16 x 22" and 14 x 24"
Rack Toms—7 x 8", 8 x 10", and 9 x 12"
Floor Toms—12 x 14", 14 x 16", and 16 x 18"
Snare Drums—5 x 14" and 6.5 x 14"

products.name: DW Collector’s Series Pure Cherry: Drummer Position
products.description:
The DW Collector’s Series Pure Cherry kit features a crisp attack with rich midrange and balanced decay characteristics. Brighter than maple, these drums are ideal for dynamic and up-tempo styles like fusion, funk, gospel, and pop. This collection includes a cherry snare with an HVLT shell and an aluminum snare with the ping and metallic quality associated with brass and steel drums.

Rack Toms—7 x 8", 8 x 10", and 10 x 12"

products.name: DW Collector’s Series Pure Maple: Drummer Position
products.description:
The DW Collector’s Series Pure Maple is a custom drum set built with Drum Workshop’s patented 333 (9-ply) shell recipe. This groundbreaking process reduces tension, allowing the shells to vibrate more freely than other designs. Handcrafted from North American hard rock maple without reinforcement hoops, this highly versatile kit offers lower fundamental tones coupled with warm resonance and full attack.

Rack Toms—7 x 8", 8 x 10", and 9 x 12"
Floor Toms—12 x 14" and 14 x 16"
Kick Drum 1—16 x 22"
Kick Drum 2—14 x 20"
Snare Drum 1—Pure Maple 6.5 x 14"
Snare Drum 2—Pure Maple 5 x 14"

products.name: DW Collector’s Series Pure Purpleheart: Drummer Position
products.description:
The DW Collector’s Series Pure Purpleheart kit features drums made from the densest tonewood used by DW. Named for its vibrant and colorful hue, purpleheart is even more dense than oak and delivers ample attack and punch. These drums offer a clean and focused tone with tight midrange and balanced resonance, making them ideal for everything from heavy rock to country and pop. The collection also includes a second snare with a bamboo shell for a bright, heavy sound.

Rack Toms—8 x 10", 10 x 12", and 10 x 13"
Floor Toms—16 x 16" and 16 x 18"

products.name: GALAXIAS
products.description:
GALAXIAS brings 50 years of legendary Roland synths and drum machines together into one powerful Super Instrument. Access thousands of iconic sounds and freely combine authentic Roland instruments from vintage to modern. Explore supermassive GALAXIAS Scenes filled with intricate layers and deep macro controls. And discover exciting new worlds with infinite creative possibilities.

Roland has been a pioneer in music technology for over half a century, delivering a continuous stream of influential instruments and effects that have fueled countless hits, defined genres, and driven cultural trends. With GALAXIAS, you can now explore and experience them all in one creative environment. From historic icons such as the JUPITER-8, TR-808, and D-50 to modern instruments like ZENOLOGY GX and SYSTEM-8, GALAXIAS harnesses Roland’s evolving sonic legacy within a single intuitive workflow.

Choose from your favorite Roland synths and drum machines, search specific sound types, or mine the ever-expanding collection of over 25,000 sounds to spark new ideas and build compelling tracks. GALAXIAS puts unlimited albums’ worth of inspiration at your command—from vintage sounds to futuristic hybrid tones—with more added each month.

GALAXIAS lets you layer up to four instruments to create massive sonic superclusters called Scenes. Build an intricate setup of your favorite Roland instruments, such as a full stack of JUPITER and JUNO synths, or multiple eras of TR drum machines locked in perfect sync. Dial in an arpeggiator pattern (or four), quickly define key ranges and macro controls, and then play the whole thing as a single instrument in the studio or on stage.

Seamlessly integrated into GALAXIAS, ZENOLOGY GX delivers over 11,000 genre-defining Roland sounds in one powerful instrument. Layer up to four instances with definable key ranges, sophisticated macro controls, per-layer effects, and creative tools like ARPS and CHORDS. Explore the vast collection of presets or craft your own using 23 authentic oscillator and filter models, over 7,000 PCM waveforms, 11 LFO shapes—including a versatile Step LFO for rhythmic movement—and 90+ effects. From studio to stage, ZENOLOGY GX puts limitless sonic potential at your fingertips.

Every layer in GALAXIAS has its own key range, transpose, and MIDI input settings. The convenient learn and drag functionality makes it fast and easy to build intricate, layered sounds that are deeply engaging and demand attention.

Experience a new level of expression and playability with the ultra-powerful macro controls in GALAXIAS. Easily assign any instrument, effect, or mix parameter to the 16 color-coded knobs and link them to a MIDI controller for real-time operation. Control multiple parameters at once and manipulate them by hand or via tempo-synced LFOs. And with the Smart Link function, you can define parameter ranges and inversions with one simple action.

In addition to the formidable effects within each individual instrument, GALAXIAS gives you two insert effects per layer and two global send effects. Choose from the growing collection of authentic Roland and BOSS effects and take your sounds to new frontiers. You can also route layers to external outputs or channels in your DAW for further processing.

Glistening arp patterns, thundering bass lines, and emotive chord progressions are only a few clicks away. Along with the onboard pattern sequencers in many of the individual instruments, GALAXIAS provides a powerful arpeggiator and dynamic chord sequencer on each layer. This feature will grow with more sequencer options and other creative tools in future updates.

The inspiring GALAXIAS interface has been carefully forged for rapid creativity and instant satisfaction. You don’t need a manual to get going, and it’s easy to go deep to quickly translate your ideas into great-sounding tracks. In fact, GALAXIAS may well be your starting point in every creative session and, paired with your favorite DAW, can take your music to unexplored territory.

While GALAXIAS can run as a standalone instrument, it also works as a multichannel plug-in for browsing, playing, and recording directly in your DAW. Arpeggiators, pattern sequencers, and LFOs sync with the master tempo, and you can even drag and drop MIDI and audio directly to tracks with some instruments. And with the future GALAXIAS roadmap, that’s only the beginning.

Delve into a single instrument layer, go deep into the full set of parameters, and get the experience of using the original hardware. With the full-screen Immersive Mode, you can toggle your focus between the entire Scene and an individual instrument or effect using a single click or key command.

Open GALAXIAS and you’ll find it bursting with instruments, sounds, effects, and creative tools to inspire your music. Powered by Roland Cloud, GALAXIAS takes full advantage of all the instruments and effects that Ultimate membership offers, delivering a sound palette of truly epic proportions.

GALAXIAS is a rapidly evolving platform instrument that will continue to improve with new sounds and capabilities added regularly. With full access to the growing library of Roland instruments and effects—and the ability to search across thousands of sounds in an instant—the GALAXIAS creative journey will only get better with time.

GALAXIAS is available exclusively with Roland Cloud Ultimate membership, which you can try for free with a 30-day all-access trial. Along with providing the fuel for the GALAXIAS environment, Roland Cloud gives you independent access to a universe of creative tools for computer-based music production, including software versions of vintage Roland instruments, ZENOLOGY, Sound Packs, Wave Expansions, Zenbeats, and much more.

Join Roland Cloud

Try GALAXIAS for free with a Roland Cloud 30-day trial membership.

products.name: Greatest Metal Tracks Vol. 01
products.description:
One Eye Open
Modeled on the track “Enter Sandman” by Metallica, as played by Lars Ulrich on the band’s eponymous fifth album (also known as The Black Album).

MyDOOM!
Practice Tomas Haake’s insane kick patterns day and night with this kit inspired by “Bleed” from the album obZen by Meshuggah.

Chow Mein!
This kit recreates the sound of the drums on System of a Down’s “Chop Suey” from the album Toxicity, as played by John Dolmayan.

R.T.T.H (Run 4 Your Life)
As classic metal songs go, “Run to the Hills” by Iron Maiden is up there with the best. Originally played by the late Clive Burr on The Number of the Beast—and performed live since 1982 by the charismatic Nicko McBrain—this kit will have you working on fast sixteenths for hours.

Du Musst (es spielen)
Translated as “you have to play it,” this kit recreates the sound of “Du Hast” by Rammstein, as played by Christoph Schneider on the band’s seminal metal album Sehnsucht.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the module’s internal instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Because the original recordings are not used within this collection, these kits should be considered as taking inspiration from the original sounds rather than being exact replicas.

The owners of the songs referenced above are not affiliated or licensed with Roland. Company names and product names referenced are registered trademarks and/or trademarks of their respective owners.

products.description:
Entertain Us
Modeled on Dave Grohl’s drums from the Nirvana album Nevermind, produced by Butch Vig. This kit is designed for playing along with the track “Smells Like Teen Spirit.”

WalkedHisWay
Recreates the sound of Joey Kramer’s drums from the classic Aerosmith track “Walk This Way.”

K.I.T.N.O.

Jumping

products.name: JUPITER-8
products.description:
Released in 1981, the JUPITER-8 is one of the most revered and sought-after polysynths of all time. It appears on countless hit tracks spanning decades, and its lush analog sound is simply unmatched for warm pads, soaring strings, and infectious lead tones. With the JUPITER-8 Software Synthesizer, you get an authentic, down-to-the-circuit-level recreation of this vintage icon for your DAW or SYSTEM-8.

The JUPITER-8 is perhaps the most desirable analog polysynth ever, with original units going for extremely high prices on the used market. It represents the pinnacle of Roland engineering in the early 1980s, with a gorgeous design, robust build, and extreme sonic flexibility. The instrument’s incredibly warm-yet-clear sound is forever imprinted on the many essential music genres that emerged during its original release. And its influence has never diminished, appearing across a range of styles to this day.

Aside from its iconic good looks and roadworthy build, the JUPITER-8 is famous for its unmistakable sound. Each of its eight voices had two stable VCOs with four waveforms to choose from, plus support for cross-modulation and screaming sync sounds. The creamy filter is renowned among synth aficionados with its selectable two- or four-pole low-pass VCF and non-resonant high-pass filter. Add in two envelopes, an onboard arpeggiator, and generous modulation capabilities, and you have the makings of a true legend.

We’ve used our proprietary circuit modeling technology to bring the JUPITER-8 to life in your DAW or SYSTEM-8. The ACB process involves carefully analyzing original hardware units, circuit diagrams, and other historical data. We then use this information to recreate the authentic circuit behaviors of the vintage instrument, including all the beloved quirks and instabilities. This is what gives the JUPITER-8 Software Synthesizer its breathtakingly lifelike sound and unique character.

While developing the JUPITER-8 plug-in, we felt it was important not to veer too far from the original’s classic workflow and sonic majesty. But we couldn’t resist adding a few modern touches like making it velocity sensitive, extending the oscillator range, adding an effects section, and enhancing the onboard arpeggiator for extra flexibility. The LFO, arpeggiator, and effects conveniently sync to tempo, and the plug-in fits perfectly into your production environment with a freely resizable, high-definition UI and support for VST3, AAX, and AU formats.

Vintage synths like the JUPITER-8 had internal trim controls that allowed technicians to tweak various analog components when they drifted out of spec. But sometimes, “out of spec” created a sound that was unique, interesting, or extraordinary. Realized through our latest ACB advancements, the newly added Circuit Mod function lets you sweep through multiple trims using a single macro control. Along with the Condition parameter, which simulates the effects of aging, you can dial in everything from a factory-primed JUPITER-8 to a road-worn synth that hasn’t seen a tech bench in decades.

The sophisticated browser lets you explore the JUPITER-8’s stunning collection of factory presets, your own custom sounds, and patches downloaded from Roland Cloud. Search across all installed patch banks, sort results, rate your favorites, jot down notes, and make quick adjustments with the integrated tweak panel.

The JUPITER-8 Software Synthesizer offers full integration with the SYSTEM-8 keyboard. You can change the JUPITER-8’s plug-in panel to match the SYSTEM-8 for intuitive, one-to-one control. Or use the PLUG-OUT functionality to turn your SYSTEM-8 into a standalone JUPITER-8 that you can play in the studio or on stage.

The JUPITER-8 Software Synthesizer is available with Roland Cloud Pro (via Pro Selector) and Ultimate memberships or a Lifetime Key purchase. Roland Cloud is also home to software versions of other vintage Roland instruments plus ZENOLOGY, ZENOLOGY FX, Zenbeats, and other inspiring music tools to back your creative journeys.

Join Roland Cloud

Try the JUPITER-8 Software Synthesizer for free with a Roland Cloud 30-day trial membership.

products.name:
ROLAND CLOUD MANAGER
Management Software
products.description:
Roland Cloud Manager opens up a world of new capabilities for your Roland hardware or software instruments. Fuel your creativity with an ever-growing collection of fresh sounds, companion apps, and more.

Roland Cloud Manager provides simple, set-it-and-forget-it management of all your Roland instruments and sounds, creative apps, editors, audio content, and more. Browse, purchase, and install with a single click and stay up to date with the latest features and fixes.

Roland Cloud contains a wealth of iconic instruments and genre-defining sounds. Install and update your entire virtual studio, from legendary synths and drum machines to carefully crafted patches and patterns from world-class sound designers.

Many Roland hardware instruments have graphical editors and companion apps to expand their capabilities. Just select the Roland hardware you own, and Roland Cloud Manager will display all the available apps and content.

Roland Cloud Manager keeps track of all your Roland Cloud instruments and sounds and notifies you of new additions. Installation is a single click or even automatic if you choose. All instruments and apps stay updated, so you always have the latest features, fixes, and OS compatibility.

Whether you're a keyboardist, drummer, wind player, or studio producer, Roland Cloud Manager lets you see just the content you're interested in. View everything Roland Cloud has to offer or filter by specific instruments or categories.

New purchases and upgrades are instant and super convenient. Join or upgrade your Roland Cloud membership and purchase Lifetime Keys for instruments and sounds right from within Roland Cloud Manager.

If you have questions about operating your Roland product, please check our Knowledge Base for answers to the most common questions.
You can also contact our Product Support through Roland Backstage.
In addition, we have a library of Owner’s Manuals and Support Documents that you can download and reference.

products.name: Slingerland Vintage 1958
products.description:
This 1958 Slingerland Radio King kit is particularly great for jazz, R&B, and singer-songwriter applications. The kick and toms have three-ply mahogany-poplar shells that deliver darker tonal qualities with rich, warm low end and medium sustain. Rounding out this collection are two different snare drum options, including a Slingerland Studio King maple snare and a DW Collector's Series Copper snare.

Rack Tom—9 x 13"
Floor Toms—16 x 16" and 16 x 18"
Kick Drum—14 x 22"
Snare Drum 1—Slingerland Studio King, 5 x 14" with maple shell
Snare Drum 2— DW Collector's Series Copper snare, 4.5 x 14"

V-Drums Instrument Expansions allow you to add new sounds to the V71, V51, and V31 modules, including complete multi-sampled acoustic drum sets, vintage and modern electronic sounds, and more. Each title provides finely tuned kits that are ready to play with no adjustment necessary. You can freely mix and match drums with the module’s onboard sound library and other installed expansions to create customized kits. It’s also possible to use the module’s deep V-Edit tools to personalize sounds to your liking.

V-Drums Instrument Expansion titles are available with Roland Cloud Ultimate or Pro memberships or a Lifetime Key purchase. Use the Roland Cloud Connect app on your mobile device to wirelessly download a collection directly to the module. Or open Roland Cloud Manager on your computer to download the installer, then transfer it to an SD card for installation via the module’s card slot.

Roland Cloud is also the home for V-Drums Kit Packs, DW Soundworks software and expansions, SPD-SX/SPD-SX PRO Kit Packs, and other curated premium content for drummers.

Download Slingerland Vintage 1958 today—available with Roland Cloud Ultimate and Pro memberships or a Lifetime Key purchase.

If you have questions about operating your Roland product, please check our Knowledge Base for answers to the most common questions.
You can also contact our Product Support through Roland Backstage.
In addition, we have a library of Owner’s Manuals and Support Documents that you can download and reference.

products.name: Practice Pack: ’70s Rock Vol. 1
products.description:
Practice along with songs inspired by the most influential music of all time with Practice Pack: ’70s Rock Vol. 1, a premium kit pack for the SPD-SX and SPD-SX PRO Sampling Pads.

Carry Me Back
Audio tracks inspired by “Rock and Roll” by Led Zeppelin.

Burn It Down
Audio tracks inspired by “Smoke on the Water” by Deep Purple.

Plenty of Room
Audio tracks inspired by “Hotel California” by the Eagles.

Black cat!
Audio tracks inspired by “Superstition” by Stevie Wonder.

Happy Days!
Audio tracks inspired by “Good Times” by Chic.

Note: The kits in this collection feature newly recorded original audio tracks inspired by the instrumentation, style, and sound of classic songs. The owners of the songs referenced above are not affiliated or licensed with Roland. Song and artist names referenced are registered trademarks and/or trademarks of their respective owners.

Practice Packs for the SPD-SX and SPD-SX PRO are specialized kit packs purpose-built for enhancing daily practice sessions with an acoustic or electronic set. Each pack includes several multitrack songs played by professional musicians. WAV loops are assigned to pads for instant triggering, enabling you to build arrangements on the fly and sharpen your groove by isolating bass, keyboards, and other instruments. Percussion sounds are also included to accent the tracks and improve your coordination between the drum set and sampling pad.

Each pack comes as a single backup file that’s ready to load into the SPD-SX via a USB flash drive or the SPD-SX PRO using a flash drive or the SPD-SX PRO App—simply download, install, and start playing. A click loop is included for timing, pre-routed to the headphones output so the audience won’t hear it in a live session or performance video.

SPD-SX/SPD-SX PRO Kit Packs are available exclusively through Roland Cloud, the home of an expanding collection of V-Drums content, classic Roland instruments, curated samples, music production tools, and jam tracks to inspire your creative journeys.

Download Practice Pack: ’70s Rock Vol. 1 today—available with a Lifetime Key purchase in Roland Cloud Manager.

If you have questions about operating your Roland product, please check our Knowledge Base for answers to the most common questions.
You can also contact our Product Support through Roland Backstage.
In addition, we have a library of Owner’s Manuals and Support Documents that you can download and reference.

A challenging kit with a polyrhythmic approach and hybrid loops that feature ethnic sounds and synth bass. BPM=100.

Ray of Sunlight
Bright, vibrant loops with reverse and dotted-eighth delays mixed with water droplet and snapshot samples. BPM=120.

products.name: SPD-SX PRO APP
products.description:
It’s never been easier to get samples in and out of your pad. Just connect the SPD-SX PRO to your computer with a USB cable and import samples.

With 32GB of memory in the SPD-SX PRO, you can fit kits for every gig. Create, edit, and organize your kits using your computer keyboard and mouse.

Easily tweak pad parameters on the SPD-SX PRO APP’s pad list/parameter edit screen. Customize the pad’s LED light colors. Set velocity and dynamics for the perfect response to your playing. Plus, exchange layer wave settings.

Your performance hinges on the sounds you make. You can edit your WAVE files to get the ideal length and playback type. Plus, set up tags for multiple files at once for simple sorting. Then, name or rename WAVE files within the list.

Download the SPD-SX PRO APP for free today through Roland Cloud Manager, the software interface for Roland Cloud content.

Roland Cloud hosts an ever-expanding universe of sounds and samples to amp up your SPD-SX PRO performance.

A versatile percussion kit with djembe, bongos, and other instruments. The relaxed ambient accompaniment track provides a great practice platform for adding percussion grooves to contemporary pop styles.

Orch Perc Kit
A powerful orchestral kit with timpani and other concert percussion. The accompaniment track features classical melodies crafted with electronic tones for a modern vibe.

Steelpan Kit
Travel to the Caribbean with this pitched steelpan kit. The calypso-style accompaniment track features a chord progression that works with all pitches within the kit.

Sample Packs for the SPD-SX and SPD-SX PRO feature newly recorded sounds organized in ready-to-play kits for specific music styles or genres. Every kit also includes a custom accompaniment track for practicing with the sounds. Each pack comes as a single backup file ready to load into the SPD-SX via a USB flash drive or the SPD-SX PRO using a flash drive or the SPD-SX PRO App—simply download, install, and start playing.

SPD-SX/SPD-SX PRO Kit Packs are available exclusively through Roland Cloud, the home of an expanding collection of V-Drums content, classic Roland instruments, curated samples, music production tools, and jam tracks to inspire your creative journeys.

Each title provides finely tuned kits that are ready to play with no adjustment necessary. You can freely mix and match drums with the module’s onboard sound library and other installed expansions to create customized kits. It’s also possible to use the module’s deep V-Edit tools to personalize sounds to your liking.

V-Drums Instrument Expansion titles are available with Roland Cloud Ultimate or Pro memberships or a Lifetime Key purchase. products.name: SYSTEM-1
products.description:
A true desert island synth, the SYSTEM-1 fuses classic and utterly modern synth tones. Spend a little time with its intuitive controls and quickly generate inspiring sounds that sit perfectly in your mixes—thumping basses, glistening arps, warm pads, plucked synths, lo-fi effects, and more.

The Scatter capability of the SYSTEM-1’s arpeggiator fuels experimentation and happy accidents. Six arpeggio types with six step settings combine with variable Scatter types and depth to create an infinite selection of patterns. In addition to notes, arpeggiate synth parameters like cutoff and resonance to build moving sequences and animated textures.

The SYSTEM-1 Software Synthesizer is a must-have for SYSTEM-1 or SYSTEM-1m hardware owners. Seamless, bi-directional communication between hardware and software gives complete editor/librarian functionality and an automatic, one-to-one hardware control interface.

Join today for full access to the future classic SYSTEM-1, along with the vintage instruments that inspired it.

products.name: SYSTEM-8
products.description:
The SYSTEM-8 draws on our deep history of synthesizer research and development, with circuit-accurate models of classic Roland oscillators, filters, and effects. It includes legendary third-party oscillator types as well, plus the famous JUPITER and JUNO filter designs for super-authentic vintage sounds.

The SYSTEM-8 does modern sounds too, with many flavors of digital and analog-style oscillators, plus waveshapes like SuperSaw, FM and more. In addition to classic filter models, options include an all-new VCF along with more recent designs like the unique formant, harmonic, and side-band filters. This makes the SYSTEM-8 unparalleled in its versatility, going from glass to growl—or pluck to punch—with just a few tweaks of its controls.

For synthesizer power users, combining the Roland SYSTEM-8 software synthesizer with its hardware sibling is a potent pairing. Sound designers will love the ability to play and shape sounds with a velocity-sensitive keyboard and dedicated controls. Live performers will appreciate transferring patches to hardware and taking the stage computer-free.

Join Roland Cloud today for full access to the powerful SYSTEM-8 and the vintage instruments that inspired it.

products.name: TB-303
products.description:
303 DAY: DJ Pierre and the Roland TB-303

Some instruments are so groundbreaking they create entire musical genres. The TB-303 is one of these influential instruments, but it wasn’t always seen that way. When Roland released the TB-303 in 1981, it was marketed as a computerized bass machine to simulate a traditional bass guitar, but didn’t quite catch on. Later on, inventive electronic musicians discovered the 303, often on the secondhand market, and found new uses for its recognizably fluid low end.

Using the 303 in new ways, DJ Pierre and Phuture pioneered what came to be known as acid. This new sound ignited other electronic music genres and, like the Roland TR-808’s influence on hip-hop, the TB-303 played an essential role in late ‘80s-early ‘90s rave culture. While we may never really understand why the 303 sound makes people want to dance, there’s no denying its power, influence, and unwavering ability to get a party started.

The TB-303 Software Synthesizer takes the classic instrument to the next level. Utilizing Analog Circuit Behavior modeling the virtual TB-303 captures the hypnotic tone of the original hardware and forms the perfect complement to the TR-909 and other classic Roland instruments. The iconic interface and signature crunch and squelch of the original are perfectly reproduced, while adding new features which surely would have turned heads back in the day:

The 303’s new editing window is one of the most striking features. For the first time, you can create and edit patterns with a visual interface. With the ability to see the DNA of a preset pattern, you can edit a variation, or start from scratch then step-edit a new pattern, using up to six octaves with user-defined scales, accents, slides, pitch manipulation, and more. The new randomize/generate functions create an endless supply of classic 303 patterns.

With five new play modes (Forward/Reverse/FWD&REV/Invert/Random) the TB-303 Software Synthesizer widens the ability to experiment. These new functions allow sonic alchemists to twist and turn the bass, changing direction at will.

For the first time, the TB-303 can hold up to 64 patterns and 64 patches per bank. The eight variations of a pattern are still accessible on the UI faceplate. Plus, with 32 preset patterns and 48 unique sounds, the 303 arrives complete with sonic templates for you to explore.

A hidden panel on the far-right corner of the 303 unlocks a variety of new tone-coloring features. Explore the expanded circuit modification via the new VCF trim, Vintage Condition, and Master Tune knobs. The onboard effects, including distortion and delay with tempo-sync, are sure to inspire fresh ideas.

Roland Cloud’s TB-303 provides the means to emulate the past or lay down brave new pathways. It’s an instrument with a proud history of shaking up the status quo and defying expectations. Use the TB-303 to leave an imprint on tomorrow’s sounds and become part of a lasting musical legacy.

Pairing with the TB-03 Roland Boutique synth or the TB-3 Touch Bassline provides hands-on control for the plug-in.

products.name: TD-17 Artist Kits 01: Craig Blundell
products.description:
CB Slam
This powerful and punchy kit features EQ purposefully tuned to bring the drums right to the front of your band’s mix. Even if you choose to tweak the tuning, your drums will proudly stand out and punch through thick, dense guitars and synths in any genre. So sit down, sit tall, and slam it!

CB Popper
This one is all about laying it down. From breaks and hip-hop to funk and big beats, this is Craig’s go-to for groove-orientated playing. Offering big depth and a snare that really pops out of the mix, this kit is a potent new addition to your sonic palette.

TD-17 Artist Kits enhance your TD-17 module with the sounds, settings, and experience of top professional drummers. They’re available exclusively through Roland Cloud, the home of an expanding collection of premium V-Drums kits, curated samples, and jam tracks to inspire your music. When you join up for membership, you’ll have access to existing content and a variety of releases the moment they arrive.

Download TD-17 Artist Kits 01: Craig Blundell today—available for free with a Roland Account and Roland Cloud Manager.

products.name: TD-17 Artist Kits 02: Anika Nilles
products.description:
AN-Dark
With this kit, Anika’s recreates her favorite acoustic drum tuning in V-Drums form. Warm and dark with controlled decay, these sounds are the backbone of her signature sound and perfect for all-day grooving.

AN-Mid
Offering a variation of Anika’s standard sound, this kit is tuned a bit higher to punch through. It also features a tambourine on the hi-hat, another sound she loves to add to her palette when playing live.

AN-Cracking
This kit features Anika’s preferred sound and tuning when playing with funk music tracks, providing a punchy drum voice that sits right up at the front of the mix.

TD-17 Artist Kits enhance your TD-17 module with the sounds, settings, and experience of top professional drummers. They’re available exclusively through Roland Cloud, the home of an expanding collection of premium V-Drums kits, curated samples, and jam tracks to inspire your music. products.name: TD-17 Artist Kits 03: Damien Schmitt
products.description:
Schmitt Kit
Damien processed this kit exactly how he processes his acoustic kit in the studio. The kick and snare are internal sounds layered with custom samples of his acoustic drums, and the toms offer tight and precise attack characteristics. The ride has just enough muffling to ensure it doesn't talk too much, providing the balance required for traditional swing or driving the cymbal in a jazz fusion style.

Timba
To play Latin music like salsa and songo, you need timbales, claves, and a cowbell. Damien is an experienced Latin music player, and he’s conceived a kit that offers a vibrant Latin percussion setup within a standard drum layout, powered by his custom samples. The hi-hat has a claves sound that’s triggered when you close the pedal firmly with the foot. The second tom has a low timbales sound on the head and a high timbales sound on the rim, while the ride is now your cowbell.

P Funk Kit
If you like the funky deadened drum sound from the 1970s, the authentic voice of this kit will instantly transport you back to that era. The kick has a low-mid tuning, the snare has a fat tone with heavy muffling, and the toms are processed the same way as the snare. Enjoy the nostalgic vibe and lose yourself in fat, retro grooves!

products.name: TD-17 Artist Kits 04: Oli Wiseman
products.description:
Trap Step
This mash-up kit combines a high-energy dubstep feel with a 140 BPM percussion loop that hints at trap music. The kick and snare deliver big, uncompromising sounds that are great fun to play, and Oli has layered his custom-made samples within the kit.

Break Out
Oli designed this kit for playing with rock music energy and the breakbeat feel commonly found in many EDM styles. Mid-tempo grooves work perfectly with the specially crafted melodic loops, and you can experiment with them to create endless combinations.

Liquid
This kit delivers an invigorating 172 BPM workout for your ghost notes. Oli's melodic loops include a percussion pattern and evolving synths, providing a solid backdrop for building technique and stamina in the left hand. Big kick and snare sounds are combined with a series of pitch-tuned snares to recreate that classic Amen break feel.

products.name: TD-17 Artist Kits 05: Kaz Rodriguez
products.description:
Kanobo Kit
The electronic music of Bonobo inspired this kit. As you play along with the loops, the heavy kit compression gives the effect of performing on a studio track—with you in the musical director’s seat.

House Kit
This kit features mellow house basslines and melodies combined with thumping, four-on-the-floor drums. The melodic parts are added to the crash and ride cymbals, allowing you to remix your own house track as you perform.

Neo Kit
This kit challenges your inner clock and helps dial in your song-playing form without the need for a click or metronome. The super laid-back loops immerse you in the groove and keep you focused on supporting the music.

products.description:
Akoenstick
This kit recreates Koen’s favorite acoustic drums, custom-tuned in the module with his studio engineering skills.

Voodoo Chambers
This kit features the original kick sample from “Violence of Your Shapes” by Koen’s band Voodoo Chambers for a powerful and punchy sound. Check out the low-pitched and dark-sounding cymbals too!

Drum Demons
Designed for soloing with ostinatos, this kit consists of percussion instruments only. Inspired by Drum Demons—the drum and percussion group that features Koen, Cesar Zuiderwijk of Golden Earring, and many other great Dutch drummers—it’s sure to test your rhythmic creativity and deliver that powerful drumline feel.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Ambient Drums Vol. 1
products.description:
Transport your drumming to world-class spaces with Ambient Drums Vol. 1, a premium collection of kits and custom layered samples for your TD-17 V-Drums sound module.

Rec Studio (Shinjuku-ku)
This kit takes inspiration from a long-established studio space in Tokyo’s Shinjuku ward, where wood walls, carpeted floors, and low ceilings come together to deliver a warm and punchy character.

Live House (Taito-ku)
The kit features a maple drum set colored with the tone of a live venue and opera hall established in the 1960s within Tokyo’s Taito ward. It features a characteristic high ceiling, creating a distinctively open and spacious presence.

Concert Tour (Birch Rock Drums)
Imagine classic birch drums, an alternative rock band, and a concert venue with a crowd of several thousand people—that’s exactly the spirit this kit is designed to capture.

Home Studio (Tight 80s Birch)
The drums on some of the greatest albums have been recorded in the most modest studio environments. This kit captures the sound of a German ’80s birch drum set within a tight and confined home space.

Arena Tour (Gigantic Drums)
Nearly every drummer dreams of performing in a massive concert arena with its huge, reverberating sound. This kit captures that iconic voice, providing a thunderous platform for jamming with your favorite rock tracks.

V-Drums Kit Packs are premium drum kits for select V-Drums modules, crafted by leading drummers and audio engineers to deliver polished, professional drum sounds for live performance, recording, and practice. Each ready-to-play kit makes full use of the module’s powerful drum editing tools and studio-grade processing for an instantly satisfying playing experience. Custom samples layered with internal drums are also included, providing unique sounds you can’t get anywhere else.

V-Drums Kit Packs are available exclusively through Roland Cloud, the home of an expanding collection of V-Drums content, classic Roland instruments, curated samples, music production tools, and jam tracks to inspire your creative journeys.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Assorted Genres Vol. 1
products.description:
Power Birch
Leveraging the rich and powerful characteristics of birch shells, this flexible kit fits with nearly any style. The sounds are enhanced with mix-ready compression and EQ, putting you on the drum throne in a studio recording booth.

Punked Up!
This aggressive kit delivers raw drum sounds reminiscent of European punk rock groups from the late ’70s and early ’80s. It features bright cymbals and a snappy high-pitched snare, plus small single-headed toms with long, tubular shells for a distinctive, percussive sound.

Jazz Rock
This solid kit features well-tuned maple shells for executing fast and detailed phrases. The module’s powerful ambience tools place this kit in a spacious live showcase club with a 200-seat capacity.

Breaks
This hip-hop kit offers a processed sound reminiscent of the drums in “Ch-Check It Out” by the Beastie Boys, an influential party dance tune from the mid-2000s.

’80s Vibes
Inspired by the punchy and polished sound of the drums on Smokey Robinson's “Just to See Her,” this kit is perfect for ’80s pop and R&B styles.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-17 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Because the original recordings are not used within this collection, these kits should be considered as taking inspiration from the original sounds rather than being exact replicas.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Greatest Funk/R&B Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Play with the sounds behind the most influential groove-driven music from the ’70s, ’80s, and ’90s with TD-17 Kit Pack: Greatest Funk/R&B Tracks Vol. 1, a premium collection of drum kits and custom layered samples for the TD-17 V-Drums sound module.

Mellow Out
Modeled on Questlove’s drum sound from the 1995 hip-hop album Do You Want More?!!!??! by The Roots. This kit is designed for playing along with the track “Mellow My Man.”

Lunar Piper
Iconic songwriter, producer, and performer Prince was backed by drummer Bobby Z. on the album Purple Rain from 1984. The powerful hybrid sound of the title track—recorded live on stage with a combination of electronic and acoustic drums—is faithfully recreated with this kit.

It’s Alright
Earth, Wind & Fire are masters of upbeat funk grooves. This kit is tuned for jamming with the track “Let’s Groove” from the band’s 1981 album Raise!

Godfather
Channel your inner “Funky Drummer” and lay it down with the kit sounds from James Brown’s classic 1970 soul track, played by the legendary Clyde Stubblefield.

Black Cats!
As drum intros go, there’s perhaps none more recognizable than Stevie Wonder’s “Superstition.” This kit perfectly captures the drum sound from the track, played by the artist himself on the 1972 album Talking Book.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-17 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Because the original recordings are not used within this collection, these kits should be considered as taking inspiration from the original sounds rather than being exact replicas.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Greatest Funk/R&B Tracks Vol. 2
products.description:
Dance 2 It
This kit emulates the drum sound of “Dance to the Music” by Sly and the Family Stone, a classic track from 1968 that highlights Greg Errico's tight and energetic drumming style.

Empty Window
This kit reproduces the drum sound of Erykah Badu's “Window Seat” from 2010. The song features a spacious groove with a distinctive bright snare sound. The kit also includes clap sounds for the song’s bridge sections.

It’s Gonna Be
Modeled on the intimate drum sounds from “Lovely Day,” as played by Russ Kunkel on the 1977 album Menagerie by singer/songwriter Bill Withers.

Virtual Jamz
Reproduces the drum sound from “Virtual Insanity,” a hit dance track from 1996 by the British band Jamiroquai that was inspired by a winter walk through an underground city space in Japan. The punchy drums lock nicely with the fat bass groove and funky keyboard sounds.

Locked Out
Modeled on the organic drum sounds from “Locked Out of Heaven,” a chart-topping track from the 2012 Unorthodox Jukebox album by singer/songwriter Bruno Mars.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Greatest Metal Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Drum with Greatest Metal Vol. 1, a hard-hitting collection of drum kits and custom layered samples for the TD-17 V-Drums sound module.

One Eye Open
Modeled on the track “Enter Sandman” by Metallica, as played by Lars Ulrich on the band’s eponymous fifth album (also known as The Black Album).

MyDOOM!
Practice Tomas Haake’s insane kick patterns day and night with this kit inspired by “Bleed” from the album obZen by Meshuggah.

Chow Mein!
This kit recreates the sound of the drums on System of a Down’s “Chop Suey” from the album Toxicity, as played by John Dolmayan.

R.T.T.H (Run 4 Your Life)
As classic metal songs go, “Run to The Hills” by Iron Maiden is up there with the best. Originally played by the late Clive Burr on The Number of the Beast—and performed live since 1982 by the charismatic Nicko McBrain—this kit will have you working on fast sixteenths for hours.

Du Musst (es spielen)
Translated as “you have to play it,” this kit recreates the sound of “Du Hast” by Rammstein, as played by Christoph Schneider on the band’s seminal metal album Sehnsucht.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-17 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Texas Metal
Modeled on “Cowboys from Hell” by Pantera, as played by Vinnie Paul on the band’s major label debut of the same name from 1990.

TearHimDown
Based on “Kill the King” from Rainbow’s 1978 album Long Live Rock ’n’ Roll, the influential band led by original Deep Purple guitarist Ritchie Blackmore. Cozy Powell's speedy and powerful drumming drives this track.

Ace It
Recreates the drum sound on Motorhead’s “Ace of Spades,” the title track from the band’s 1980 album release. This song features fast, tight drumming by Phil “Philthy Animal” Taylor.

HallowedBeat
Models the heavy drum sound from “Sole Survivor” by the long-running German power metal band Helloween. This track was on the 1994 album Master of the Rings and features monster drumming from Uli Kusch.

ForAllMySins
The drum sound from “Punishment” on Biohazard's 1992 album Urban Discipline. This intense, multi-tempo track combines hardcore punk, heavy metal, and hip-hop elements.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Greatest Rock Tracks Vol. 3
products.description:
CrackinUp
Modeled on Tré Cool’s high-intensity drum sound from “Basket Case” on Dookie, Green Day’s major-label debut from 1994.

StillSeeking
Groove along with the majestic drum sound from U2’s “I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For,” as played by Larry Mullen Jr. on the band’s iconic album The Joshua Tree from 1987.

Golden Rise
Jam with the resonant drums from “Sunshine of Your Love,” one of the foundational hard rock songs from the 1960s. Filled with inventive tom-driven playing by Ginger Baker, this track is on Cream’s Disraeli Gears album from 1967.

SOSBeat
This kit is based on “Message in a Bottle” by The Police, which appears on the band’s 1979 album Reggatta de Blanc. Played by Stewart Copeland, this drumming masterpiece features reggae-inspired grooves, deft hi-hat phrasing, and a distinctive high-pitched snare.

SaveUrslf
This heavy kit captures Brad Wilk’s driving drum sound from “Cochise” on Audioslave's self-titled 2002 debut. This supergroup featured members from Soundgarden and Rage Against the Machine.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-17 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Because the original recordings are not used within this collection, these kits should be considered as taking inspiration from the original sounds rather than being exact replicas.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Instrumental Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Heavy Boots
Modeled on the drum sound from “Led Boots” on Jeff Beck’s Wired album from 1976. This track features impressive grooves and intricate fills by drummer Narada Michael Walden.

Jazz Lizzard
Recreates Harvey Mason’s punchy drum sound on “Chameleon,”a landmark jazz-fusion track from Herbie Hancock’s 1973 album Head Hunters.

Surfed Out
The iconic drum sound from the surf anthem “Wipe Out.” First released in 1963 by the Surfaris, it’s been covered by the Ventures and many other artists since.

Why Why Zed?
Challenge your chops with “YYZ,” a popular instrumental track from Rush’s 1981 album Moving Pictures. Many of the group’s live performances of this song featured mesmerizing solos by drummer Neal Peart.

Get a Cob On
Recreates the drum sound from “Red Baron” on Billy Cobham’s 1973 solo debut Spectrum. This simple grooving fusion track features a wealth of clever drum fills from Cobham.

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Timeless Pop Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Drum along with multiple generations of enduring tunes using Timeless Pop Tracks Vol. 1, a premium collection of drum kits and custom layered samples for the TD-17 V-Drums sound module.

Only Thunder
Modeled on the vintage mid-’70s dry drum sound from “Dreams” on Fleetwood Mac’s Rumours album, as played by Mick Fleetwood.

YeahYeahYeah
The fat, driving drum sound from “I’m Still Standing" by Elton John, performed by Nigel Olsson on the Too Low for Zero album from 1983.

Parrot Dice
A contemporary hybrid drum sound inspired by “Paradise” from Coldplay’s 2011 album Mylo Xyloto, played by Will Champion.

Downtown
Lay down punchy retro backbeats with this kit based on “Uptown Girl” from Billy Joel’s 1983 album An Innocent Man, a song inspired by 1960s vocal groups and played by Joel’s longtime drummer, Liberty DeVitto.

Not My Lover
The snappy hybrid drum sound from Michael Jackson’s classic track “Billie Jean.” Performed by drummer Leon “Ndugu” Chancler on Thriller from 1982, the best-selling album of all time.

Can’t U See

All I Need
The drum sound from “Sunday Morning” by Maroon 5, as played by Ryan Dusick on the band’s 2002 debut album Songs About Jane.

Without Love

See U Tonite

products.name: TD-17 Kit Pack: Upfront Drums Vol. 1
products.description:
Studio Funk
This kit features a poppy brass snare and maple toms processed with punchy lo-fi compression for a strong attack with warm, resonant overtones. Perfect for classic funk and soul styles, these inspiring drum tones also work nicely with rock and alternative genres.

Close & Punchy
Recreates the close-mic sound of modern studio drums, highlighted by a ringing brass snare and beech drum shells for a full and punchy delivery. Ideal for rock, pop, and country styles.

Bright Rock
Crafted with alternative rock in mind, this loud-and-proud kit features birch drum shells for a strong attack and a stainless-steel snare that easily slices through driving guitars and bass. Heavy studio-style compression delivers punch and presence to form a solid foundation for any rock performance.

Warm Soul
Perfect for soul, funk, and ’70s music styles, this kit is tailor-made for generating fat backbeats. The mahogany snare and maple drum shells have a warm, roomy sound, and a variety of percussion and clap sounds are also available to add color and interest.

Full Metal
This monster kit features huge, thunderous drum sounds with plenty of attack and definition, allowing fast, precision playing to cut through the densest mixes. An aluminum snare combined with birch drum shells creates the perfect platform for high-impact double-kick playing and blast beats.

products.name: TD-17 Version 2 Update
products.description:
The free Roland Cloud Version 2 update for TD-17 drum kits adds an array of new features and enhancements to the module.

TD-17 Version 2 adds 20 new premium-quality preset kits, bringing the onboard total to 70. Experience the warm vibes of “Acoustic,” or play on a small stage with the tight “Shallow Mini” kit. Rock heavy in the wide-open expanse of “Arena Stage,” or go for maximum recording clarity with the clean and defined “BigWoodShell” kit. And that’s just a start—whatever music drives your passion, the TD-17 will help you get there.

You’re not just limited to the preset kits inside the TD-17 module. Explore an ever-growing range of content on Roland Cloud, including artist kits from pro drummers like Anika Nilles, Craig Blundell, Kaz Rodriguez, and more. Once you have a free Roland Cloud account, download what appeals to you and dig in.

All the internal instruments in the TD-17 can be further enhanced by loading and layering user samples. The TD-17 Version 2 update automatically loads 26 professional quality samples, which are used in the 20 new preset kits. The samples can also be freely assigned to other preset and custom kits to develop new tones and timbres.

When drums are professionally recorded, reverbs and compressors are often added in the mixing phase to enhance individual drums or the entire kit. TD-17 Version 2 adds these powerful processing tools, allowing you to bring studio polish to kits and create drum sounds as individual as you are.

The TD-17’s Multi FX section is another excellent way to change up your sound and bring fresh inspiration to your playing. Eleven new types have been added to the module’s already impressive arsenal, including Equalizer, Spectrum, Low Boost, Enhancer, Humanizer, Slicer, Step Flanger, Hexa-Chorus, 4Tap Pan Delay, Enhancer→Flanger, and Speaker Simulator.

TD-17 Version 2 also includes trigger parameter settings for the latest V-Pads and V-Cymbals, including the thin-profile CY-12C-T crash and CY-14R-T ride.

Download TD-17 Version 2 today—available for free with a Roland Account and Roland Cloud Manager.

You can also contact our Product Support through Roland Backstage.
In addition, we have a library of Owner’s Manuals and Support Documents that you can download and reference.

products.name: TD-27 Kit Pack: Ambient Drums Vol. 1
products.description:
Transport your drumming to world-class spaces with Ambient Drums Vol. 1, a premium collection of kits and custom layered samples for your TD-27 V-Drums sound module.

Reflection (90s Echo Chamber)
Sound reflection is a key characteristic of this kit. Inspired by concrete drum rooms with tall ceilings, the immersive reverberation has an atmospheric feel that’s almost trip-hop in style.

Studioverb
Inspired by a Japanese recording studio known for its unique reverberation, this kit captures the natural, open sound of a large space.

Concert Tour (Birch Rock Drums)
Imagine classic birch drums, an alternative rock band, and a concert venue with a crowd of several thousand people—that’s exactly the spirit this kit is designed to capture.

Home Studio (Tight 80s Birch)
The drums on some of the greatest albums have been recorded in the most modest studio environments. This kit captures the sound of a German ’80s birch drum set within a tight and confined home space.

Studio Snare (High Roof Mic)
A recording studio located in the Nakano ward is synonymous with Tokyo’s rock, alternative, and metal scene. Its high ceiling helps to create a snare sound with unique snap, punch, and reverb characteristics—all captured within this kit.

products.name: TD-27 Kit Pack: Assorted Genres Vol. 1
products.description:
Vintage 24”
With its open 24” kick drum and ’60s-era U.S. snare, this retro kit has the perfect vibe for old-school rock, pop, and blues.

Soul Skool
Ideal for classic soul tracks, this kit uses the module’s onboard processing tools to create a tight, percussive sound with vintage-style studio compression and tape drive.

StudioFusion
This kit delivers a lively studio drum sound heard on many contemporary tracks. The crisp and articulate character of the hard maple shells is great for clean, modern grooves and detailed phrasing.

Breaks
This hip-hop kit offers a processed sound reminiscent of the drums in “Ch-Check It Out” by the Beastie Boys, an influential party dance tune from the mid-2000s.

’80s Vibes
Inspired by the punchy and polished sound of the drums on Smokey Robinson's “Just to See Her,” this kit is perfect for ’80s pop and R&B styles.

products.name: TD-27 Kit Pack: Greatest Funk/R&B Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Play with the sounds behind the most influential groove-driven music from the ’70s, ’80s, and ’90s with TD-27 Kit Pack: Greatest Funk/R&B Tracks Vol. 1, a premium collection of drum kits and custom layered samples for the TD-27 V-Drums sound module.

Mellow Out
Modeled on Questlove’s drum sound from the 1995 hip-hop album Do You Want More?!!!??! by The Roots. This kit is designed for playing along with the track “Mellow My Man.”

Lunar Piper
Iconic songwriter, producer, and performer Prince was backed by drummer Bobby Z. on the album Purple Rain from 1984. The powerful hybrid sound of the title track—recorded live on stage with a combination of electronic and acoustic drums—is faithfully recreated with this kit.

It’s Alright
Earth, Wind & Fire are masters of upbeat funk grooves. This kit is tuned for jamming with the track “Let’s Groove” from the band’s 1981 album Raise!

Godfather
Channel your inner “Funky Drummer” and lay it down with the kit sounds from James Brown’s classic 1970 soul track, played by the legendary Clyde Stubblefield.

Black Cats!
As drum intros go, there’s perhaps none more recognizable than Stevie Wonder’s “Superstition.” This kit perfectly captures the drum sound from the track, played by the artist himself on the 1972 album Talking Book.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-27 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Because the original recordings are not used within this collection, these kits should be considered as taking inspiration from the original sounds rather than being exact replicas.

products.description:
Dance 2 It
This kit emulates the drum sound of “Dance to the Music” by Sly and the Family Stone, a classic track from 1968 that highlights Greg Errico's tight and energetic drumming style.

Empty Window
This kit reproduces the drum sound of Erykah Badu's “Window Seat” from 2010. The song features a spacious groove with a distinctive bright snare sound. The kit also includes clap sounds for the song’s bridge sections.

It’s Gonna Be
Modeled on the intimate drum sounds from “Lovely Day,” as played by Russ Kunkel on the 1977 album Menagerie by singer/songwriter Bill Withers.

Virtual Jamz
Reproduces the drum sound from “Virtual Insanity,” a hit dance track from 1996 by the British band Jamiroquai that was inspired by a winter walk through an underground city space in Japan. The punchy drums lock nicely with the fat bass groove and funky keyboard sounds.

Locked Out
Modeled on the organic drum sounds from “Locked Out of Heaven,” a chart-topping track from the 2012 Unorthodox Jukebox album by singer/songwriter Bruno Mars.

products.name: TD-27 Kit Pack: Greatest Metal Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Jam along with Greatest Metal Vol. 1, a hard-hitting collection of drum kits and custom layered samples for the TD-27 V-Drums sound module.

One Eye Open
Modeled on the track “Enter Sandman” by Metallica, as played by Lars Ulrich on the band’s eponymous fifth album (also known as The Black Album).

MyDOOM!
Practice Tomas Haake’s insane kick patterns day and night with this kit inspired by “Bleed” from the album obZen by Meshuggah.

Chow Mein!
This kit recreates the sound of the drums on System of a Down’s “Chop Suey” from the album Toxicity, as played by John Dolmayan.

R.T.T.H (Run 4 Your Life)
As classic metal songs go, “Run to The Hills” by Iron Maiden is up there with the best. Originally played by the late Clive Burr on The Number of the Beast—and performed live since 1982 by the charismatic Nicko McBrain—this kit will have you working on fast sixteenths for hours.

Du Musst (es spielen)
Translated as “you have to play it,” this kit recreates the sound of “Du Hast” by Rammstein, as played by Christoph Schneider on the band’s seminal metal album Sehnsucht.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-27 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. Because the original recordings are not used within this collection, these kits should be considered as taking inspiration from the original sounds rather than being exact replicas.

products.description:
Texas Metal
Modeled on “Cowboys from Hell” by Pantera, as played by Vinnie Paul on the band’s major label debut of the same name from 1990.

TearHimDown
Based on “Kill the King” from Rainbow’s 1978 album Long Live Rock ’n’ Roll, the influential band led by original Deep Purple guitarist Ritchie Blackmore. Cozy Powell's speedy and powerful drumming drives this track.

Ace It
Recreates the drum sound on Motorhead’s “Ace of Spades,” the title track from the band’s 1980 album release. This song features fast, tight drumming by Phil “Philthy Animal” Taylor.

HallowedBeat
Models the heavy drum sound from “Sole Survivor” by the long-running German power metal band Helloween. This track was on the 1994 album Master of the Rings and features monster drumming from Uli Kusch.

ForAllMySins
The drum sound from “Punishment” on Biohazard's 1992 album Urban Discipline. This intense, multi-tempo track combines hardcore punk, heavy metal, and hip-hop elements.

products.description:
Entertain Us
Modeled on Dave Grohl’s drums from the Nirvana album Nevermind, produced by Butch Vig. This kit is designed for playing along with the track “Smells Like Teen Spirit.”

WalkedHisWay
Recreates the sound of Joey Kramer’s drums from the classic Aerosmith track “Walk This Way.”

K.I.T.N.O.
The drum sound of Brad Wilk of Rage Against the Machine is captured in this kit, perfect for playing along with “Killing in the Name” from the band’s eponymous debut album.

Burning ’74
The driving sound of mid-’70s hard rock in the form of Ian Paice’s drum set, made to accompany the track “Burn” from the Deep Purple album of the same name.

Jumping
Classic ’80s pop-metal drums, designed to sound like Alex Van Halen’s kit on “Jump” from the 1984 album by Van Halen.

Wash Away

Metal Helmet
Captures the drum sound on the track “Wilma’s Rainbow,” as played by John Stanier on the album Betty by the alternative metal band Helmet.

Out and Out
The distinctive dry drum sound from the progressive rock track “Roundabout” by Yes, as played by Bill Bruford on the 1971 album Fragile.

B-I-B
The drum sound from AC/DC’s iconic “Back in Black,” played by Phil Rudd on the 1980 album of the same name.

products.name: TD-27 Kit Pack: Greatest Rock Tracks Vol. 3
products.description:
CrackinUp
Modeled on Tré Cool’s high-intensity drum sound from “Basket Case” on Dookie, Green Day’s major-label debut from 1994.

StillSeeking
Groove along with the majestic drum sound from U2’s “I Still Haven’t Found What I’m Looking For,” as played by Larry Mullen Jr. on the band’s iconic album The Joshua Tree from 1987.

Golden Rise
Jam with the resonant drums from “Sunshine of Your Love,” one of the foundational hard rock songs from the 1960s. Filled with inventive tom-driven playing by Ginger Baker, this track is on Cream’s Disraeli Gears album from 1967.

SOSBeat
This kit is based on “Message in a Bottle” by The Police, which appears on the band’s 1979 album Reggatta de Blanc. Played by Stewart Copeland, this drumming masterpiece features reggae-inspired grooves, deft hi-hat phrasing, and a distinctive high-pitched snare.

SaveUrslf
This heavy kit captures Brad Wilk’s driving drum sound from “Cochise” on Audioslave's self-titled 2002 debut. This supergroup featured members from Soundgarden and Rage Against the Machine.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-27 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds. products.name: TD-27 Kit Pack: Instrumental Tracks Vol. 1
products.description:
Heavy Boots
Modeled on the drum sound from “Led Boots” on Jeff Beck’s Wired album from 1976. This track features impressive grooves and intricate fills by drummer Narada Michael Walden.

Jazz Lizzard
Recreates Harvey Mason’s punchy drum sound on “Chameleon," a landmark jazz-fusion track from Herbie Hancock’s 1973 album Head Hunters.

Surfed Out
The iconic drum sound from the surf anthem “Wipe Out.” First released in 1963 by the Surfaris, it’s been covered by the Ventures and many other artists since.

Why Why Zed?
Challenge your chops with “YYZ,” a popular instrumental track from Rush’s 1981 album Moving Pictures. Many of the group’s live performances of this song featured mesmerizing solos by drummer Neal Peart.

Get a Cob On
Recreates the drum sound from “Red Baron” on Billy Cobham’s 1973 solo debut Spectrum. This simple grooving fusion track features a wealth of clever drum fills from Cobham.

Note: The kits in this collection have been created using the internal TD-27 instruments and editing tools combined with newly developed samples to reinforce certain drum sounds.
